requirements: Permission of the instructor required; qualified undergraduates are welcome.
description:
This interdisciplinary seminar focuses on the tangled relations of religion and museums, historically and in the present. What does it mean to “exhibit religion” in the institutional context of the museum? What practices of display might one encounter for this subject? What kinds of museums most frequently invite religious display? How is religion suited (or not) for museum exhibition and museum education?
Permission of the instructor required; qualified undergraduates are welcome.
title: Religion and Museums
